item.description:
You probably know that over half of all Americans die from heart disease, cancer, or diabetes. But did you know that these conditions can be prevented, delayed, reversed, or even cured by diet and lifestyle changes?

Learn more at a free five-week film and discussion series on Wednesdays, October 19-November 16, 2011, 7:00-9:00 pm, at the Fellowship Building, 7 Elm Street, Harvard, MA.

There is no charge for attendance.

Participants may attend any part or all of the film/discussion series. Light refreshments will be provided, so RSVP is encouraged but not required.

 The full schedule is as follows:

·         October 19 – “Kickstart Your Health,” with Dr. Neal Barnard, as seen on public television; and “Processed People,” featuring nine experts on nutrition, diet, and health: Caldwell Esselstyn, MD; Joel Fuhrman, MD; Jay Gordon, MD; Jeffrey Masson, PhD; John McDougall, MD; Milton Mills, MD; Jeff Novick, MS, RD, LD, LN; Pam Popper, ND, PhD; and John Robbins.

·         October 26 – “Forks over Knives,” as seen recently in theatres, featuring professor and author T. Colin Campbell and Dr. Caldwell Esselstyn

·         November 2 – “A Delicate Balance—The Truth” and excerpts from “Forks over Knives” additional material

·         November 9 – “3 Steps to Incredible Health,” as seen on public television, featuring Dr. Joel Fuhrman; and “Milk is for Baby Cows,” with Dr. John McDougall

·         November 16 – “Tackling Diabetes with Dr. Neal Barnard,” as seen on public television, and “Touring the Grocery Store,” with Caroline Trapp, MSN, CDE, and Susan Levine, MS, RD

 

John Ball, course facilitator and member of the Vegan MW Network, is a passionate advocate for improving personal health through nutrition and diet. He is on the Harvard Community Cable Access Committee, on which he airs programs on these topics. To find out more about this course or to register for one or more evenings in the series, email JohnABall@verizon.net or call him at 978-456-3552.

This film/discussion course is sponsored by the Harvard Unitarian Universalist Church (HUUC).

 

John Ball, 978-456-3552

JohnABall@verizon.net
item.name: Eat Yourself Healthy Free Film Series (4th of 5)
